data.what_is:
eSputnik is an omnichhannel customer data platform (CDP) that allows to manage cross-channel messaging campaigns via Email, web and mobile push, in-app, app inbox, widgets in a single system, segment audience according to the customer's interestes, create product recommendations based on client's behaviour and easily automate all your marketing activities.

Features for advanced eCommerce projects:
- Dynamic content depending on stock availability, geo, browsing history or by feed.
- AI-based personalized product recommendations: 198 ready and tested algorithms for recommendation generation are included in the system, custom development is possible.
- Advanced segmentation: by user behavior, events, parameters, RFM analysis, cohort analysis, predictive segmentation, value-based customer segmentation.
- 15 pro-triggers for ecommerce - created segments and events, campaign timeframes. 
- Multilanguage allows to automate work with scripts, templates, scheduling of mailings.
- Conditional dynamic blocks targeted on additional data enrichment.
- Dynamic message content queue prioritization based on previous behavior.
- Messaging frequency control. 
- High server/ip reputation for inbox deliverability.
-   High delivery speed for flash sales.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about eSputnik?
Only flexible pricing options. Nothing more.

What do you dislike about eSputnik?
At the begining was ok, later paid (transfered) for better plan, and "fun" has started. Firstly, their consultants started asking about our subscribed contacts, as they did not like something, but we provided all info including screen shots on subscription methods and policies and etc. However at the end of long discussion, they state that they "doubt", and did not let us use services anymore. Ok, it is theirs platform and they have the right to state any decisions, but where is refund for no service then? After we asked for refund - no response since. So lets see if they look like shiny silver too? Firstly, all payments are done to Ukrainian bank ( 3rd world country.) and it looks like very suspicious as gives very little trust. Secondly, all support team are under russian names, so it looks like it is Russian company... And who knows what is their direct purpose, for example more doubts arise when you upload you your contacts and you cannot permanently delete them later. So you will never know, where they might use them later, and recent worldwide events shows that similar cases has happened and at one end was Russia. Lastly, you will pay or get a plan, and they can just freeze your account, do not give any logical and acceptable reason, just personal statement and furthermore no refund and you are done. So it looks like that esputnik and their service has much more doubts and questions to answer themselves. And its up to you to trust or not their services. Sadly, but it is a fact, and we think to trust your most valuable assets - contacts, with a risk that you might face the fact when you will pay and will get no service, is not worth. Be careful not to get in the same boat with us when your will get stupid questions from support, and in order to answer you must reveal your confidential data, and at the end your account might be freezed and no option for claim or refund. So for us it looks like it is new way of getting your subscribed contacts and not giving back service that you pay for.

No benefits for the reasons mentioned above
